japanese:
呼び出してすまんな、三玖。
しかも考え事をしている最中に。
translation:
Sorry for calling you out, Miku.
Especially when you were lost in thought.

japanese:
いいけど……今度はどうしたの？
キッチンに来てくれだなんて。
translation:
It's okay...
Calling me to the kitchen like this.
What's going on this time?

japanese:
そんなの決まってるだろう？
料理を作ってくれ。
translation:
That's obvious, isn't it?
Cook up something to eat.

japanese:
おい、聞こえなかったのか？
俺に料理を作ってくれ。
translation:
Hey, could you not hear me?
Cook me up something to eat.

japanese: ええっ！？
translation: HUHHH?!

japanese:
なぜそんなに驚く。
別におかしなことは言ってないだろう。
translation:
Why are you so surprised?
I didn't say anything strange.

japanese:
た、タイミングがおかしい。
どうして……。
translation:
Th-the timing is just off.
Why?

japanese: 腹が減ったからだ！
translation: Because I'm HUNGRY!

japanese: ええー……。
translation: Huuhh...

japanese:
困ったことに、
このままでは空腹で死んじまいそうでな！

他の人に作ってもらえばいい。
らいはちゃんとか。
translation:
You can ask someone else to make it for you.
Like Raiha-chan.

japanese: 俺は三玖の料理が食いたい。
translation: I want to eat your cooking, Miku.

japanese: そ、そんなこと言われても、困る。
translation: E-even if you say that, it'll be a problem.

japanese:
俺だって困ってるんだ。
お前の料理以外は腹に入りそうにない。
translation:
I'm the one with a problem.
I don't think I'll be able to eat anything else
but your cooking.

japanese: なにそれ……。
translation: What the...

japanese: わからん、そういう日もあるってことだ！
translation:
I don't really get it,
but I guess it's just one of those days!

japanese:
はあ……。
わかった、準備するから座ってて。
translation:
*sigh*
I understand, sit tight while I prepare it.

japanese:
そうか！
よかった、これで生き延びられそうだ！
translation:
Really!
Great, now I can keep on living.

japanese: もう……。
translation: Geez...

japanese:
食材は……うん、大丈夫そう。
フータロー、何か食べたいものはある？
translation:
The ingredients...
Hmm, looks like we have everything we need.
Futaro, is there anything specific you want to eat?

japanese:
美味いものならなんでもいいぞ。
美味いものならな。
translation:
I'll eat anything that's delicious.
Anything delicious.

japanese: ……なんで２回も言ったの？
translation: ...Why did you say it twice?

japanese:
それはもちろん、まずいものなんて
食いたくないからに決まってる！
translation:
Of course, that's because I don't want to eat anything
that tastes bad!

japanese: わかった。
translation: Got it.

japanese: なんでも美味しいって言うのに。
translation: Even though you say everything is delicious.

japanese: どうぞ、召し上がれ。
translation: Here you are. Eat up.

japanese:
おう。
じゃ、いただきます。
translation:
Alright.
Time to eat, then.

japanese: はむっ……。
translation: Nom...

japanese: どう？
translation: How is it?

japanese: うん、不味いな。
translation: Yeah, it's not very tasty.

japanese:
――えっ？
今、なんて……。
translation:
%p-2;――%p; Huh?
What did you just, say?

japanese: 俺は！　『不味い』と言ったんだ！
translation: I said! It's 'not very tasty'!

japanese: な、なんで……。
translation: Wh-why?

japanese:
なんで、だと？
いくら俺が味音痴でも、
不味いものを食べたら不味いと言うが？
translation:
Why, you ask?
Even though I have no taste,
I can still say something is bad if it's bad.

japanese:
でも、前に、四葉が石みたいって言ったコロッケも
美味しいって。
translation:
But before, you said that the croquettes
Yotsuba said were like rocks
were still delicious.

japanese: ああ、あれのほうが数倍ましだな！
translation: Yeah, those were much better than this!

japanese:
腕が落ちたんじゃないか？
昨日今日と料理をサボるからだぞ？
継続は力なりくらい聞いたことはあるよな？
translation:
Have your skills declined?
You've been skipping out on cooking lately.
You've heard that perseverance is key, right?
Ooh...

japanese:
ちなみに、こいつに関しては……
そうだなぁ、コクがないっていうのか？
余韻が感じられん！
translation:
By the way, this dish...
Let's see, it just doesn't have enough depth.
It's got no umami!

japanese: だったら、もう一度作る。
translation: In that case, I'll cook it again.

japanese:
そりゃ楽しみだ。
ぜひとも、この俺の舌を唸らせる料理を
作ってくれたまえ。
translation:
Looking forward to it.
Please make a dish that will make my taste buds sing!

japanese: できた、食べて。
translation: Here it is. Eat up.

japanese:
不味い！
味にメリハリがない！
translation:
This is gross!
There's no variety in the taste!

japanese: じゃあ、これ！
translation: Then, this!

japanese:
あー、なんだ！　その、あれだ、味に深みがない！
雲を食ってるようだな！
translation:
Ah, what's this?!
There's, like, no richness to the taste!
It's like I'm eating a cloud!

japanese: これなら……！
translation: How about this?!

japanese:
うぷっ……。
ざ、残念だがこれも不味い。
味が薄いぞ、今は上品さなどいらんわ！
translation:
Urp... 
I-it's a shame, but this is bad too.
It's too bland, I will take nothing but the best right now!

japanese:
（うっぷ、さすがにもう腹いっぱいだ。
　これ以上は一口も食えん……）
translation:
(Burp, I'm so totally full.
 I can't eat another bite...)

japanese:
……一度もフータローに美味しいって
言わせられなかった。
translation:
...You didn't say my cooking was delicious even once,
Futaro.

japanese:
くっくっく……。
三玖もまだまだだな……。
translation:
He-he-he...
You've still got some work to do, Miku...

japanese:
まだ食べられるよね？
フータローが満足するまで、
完璧に美味しくなるまで作るから。
translation:
You can still eat more, right?
I'll keep cooking until it's perfect
and you're satisfied, Futaro.

japanese:
……はは。
そうだな、その台詞だ。
translation:
...Haha.
There you go, that's the spirit.

japanese: なに笑ってるの？
translation: What are you laughing at?

japanese:
だから、『美味しくなるまで作る』だよ。
石コロッケのときにもそんなこと言ったぞ、お前。
translation:
Because you said you'll 'cook until it comes out delicious.'
I even said the stone croquettes were delicious,
remember?
Ah...

japanese:
そして、俺がこうして満腹になるまで
食わされてるのまで同じだ。
translation:
Filling me up like this till I'm full,
and feeding me is the same thing.

japanese:
ホントだ、私、同じことしてる。
成長してないってことかな。
translation:
It's true. We're doing the same thing.
It means I haven't grown.

japanese:
成長してるさ。
少なくとも、あのときは文句ばかりだった四葉が
お前の料理を嬉しそうに食ってるんだぞ？
translation:
You have grown.
At least, Yotsuba who used to complain all the time,
is happily eating your cooking now.

japanese: ……うん。
translation: ...Yes.

japanese:
なあ、三玖。
そうやって成長できたのは……
誰かのためって気持ちだけだと本当に思うか？
translation:
Hey Miku, do you really think that the only reason
you were able to grow so much...
was for someone else's sake?

japanese: 思う、けど。
translation: I think so.

japanese: 俺は違うと思うぞ。
translation: I DON'T think so.

japanese:
えっ……。
じゃあ、どうして？
translation:
Huh...?
Why not?

japanese: ……さっきの話の続きだ。
translation: ...I'm gonna continue what I was saying before.

japanese:
勉強していい大学に進学するのは
らいはちゃんのため、って話？
translation:
Seeking higher education at a university
where you can study,
and that being for Raiha-chan's sake?

japanese:
そうだ。
けど三玖、それはお前の早とちりだ。
人の話はちゃんと最後まで聞け。
translation:
That's right.
However, Miku, you're jumping to the wrong conclusions.
Listen to me until the end.

japanese: ……ごめん。
translation: ...Sorry.

japanese:
俺も最初から勉強が好きだったわけじゃない。
お前が最初から料理が好きだったわけじゃ
ないようにな。
translation:
I didn't like studying at first. 
Just like how you didn't like cooking at first.

japanese:
だが、あるとき、ある人によって
学力が俺の武器になると気がつかされた。
それからだよ、勉強に打ち込んだのは。
translation:
But one time, someone made me realize
that my intelligence could be my weapon.
That's when I started dedicating myself to studying.

japanese: 私が……フータローに気づかせてもらったみたいに。
translation: Like...how you made me realize, Futaro.

japanese:
そんな俺からすれば、お前がここまで上達できたのが
誰か１人のためだけとは思えない。
translation:
For me, having learned that,
I can't imagine that you improved this much
just for one person.

japanese:
俺は、勉強に楽しさを見いだして、
勉強をすることで成せることがあると
確信して、ここまできた。
translation:
I found the joy in studying,
and I believed that it could lead to greater things.
That's how I got to where I am now.

japanese:
（そう、俺の中で
　かみ合ってなかったのはこれなんだ）
translation: (I see, so that's what didn't click inside of me.)

japanese: だから、お前もそうなんじゃないか？
translation: So, isn't it the same for you?

japanese:
料理そのものが好きで、楽しんでいて、
料理を通じて成せることがあると気がつき始めてる。
translation:
You love cooking itself,
and you're starting to realize that you can
accomplish things through cooking while having fun.

japanese:
修学旅行の、お前のパンから伝わった努力の味も
その結果だろ？
お前に自覚はないのかもしれないけどな。
translation:
The taste of your bread during our school trip,
that's also the result of your efforts, right?
Maybe you're not aware of that, though.

japanese: フータロー……。
translation: Futaro...

japanese:
……お前は、料理を始めたばかりなんだ。
今はまだきっかけから先には進めなくても、
そのうち次の目標が見つかる。
translation:
...You've only just started cooking.
It's okay if you can't move past the initial spark
right now. You'll eventually find your next goal.

japanese: 次の目標……。
translation: My next goal...

japanese:
たとえば、自分の料理をたくさんの人に
美味いと言ってもらう、とかな。
translation:
Like, for example, having lots of people
say that your cooking is delicious.

japanese:
そうやって、お前は……
誰かの１人のためなんてところで満足せずに
もっと上を目指そうとするに決まってる。
translation:
In that way...
You won't be satisfied just helping one person
and...and you'll always aim for more.

japanese:
お前はそういうやつだ。
だから焦る必要なんてないぞ。
俺が保証してやる。
translation:
That's the kind of person you are.
So, you don't need to rush.
I guarantee it.

japanese: ……フータローに保証されてもね。
translation: ...Even you guarantee it, Futaro.

japanese:
なんだよ、その言い方は。
俺は、お前ならできると本気で思ってるぞ。
translation:
What's with that way of talking?
I really do believe that you can do it.

japanese: ……うん。
translation: ...Yes.

japanese:
またフータローに助けられちゃった。
自分でちゃんと答えを出したい、なんて言っておいて。
translation:
You've helped me again, Futaro.
Even though I said that
I wanted to find the answer on my own.

japanese: じゃ、前に進めないか？
translation: So, you say you can't move forward?

japanese:
ううん、進める。
見つけたきっかけはフータローだけど、
そもそも、もう答えは私の中にあったんだから。
translation:
No, I can do it.
Even though you were the reason for that spark,
the answer was already inside me.

japanese:
よし、模範解答だ。
満点をやってもいい。
translation:
Good, that's the perfect answer.
You deserve full marks.

japanese:
……ありがと。
本当に、色々ありがとう、フータロー。
translation:
...Thanks.
Really, thank you for so much, Futaro.

japanese:
気にするな。
まあ、これも家庭教師としての、仕事の延長、だ。
translation:
Don't mention it.
I mean, it's just an extension of my job
as your tutor.

japanese:
（……あ、ヤバい。
　そろそろ立ってるのがキツくなって……）
translation:
(...Ah, oh no.
 I'm so full...it's getting hard to stand up...)

japanese:
えっ、ええ！？　なんで倒れるの！？
フータロー、大丈夫！？
translation:
W-woah?! Why are you falling over?!
Futaro, are you okay?!

japanese:
し、心配するな。
食べすぎで、横になってるほうが楽なんだ。
translation:
I-I'm okay.
I ate too much, so laying on my side
is more comfortable.

japanese:
でも、こんなところで。
部屋か、せめてリビングに……。
translation:
But here, of all places?
At least go to your room, or the living room...

japanese: しばらく動けそうにないんだよ……。
translation: I don't think I can move for a while...

japanese: じゃ、じゃあ……。
translation: A-alright, then...

japanese:
えっ……ちょ、三玖！？
お前、何を……。
translation:
Umm... Hold on, MIKU?!
What are you doing?

japanese: こ、こんな感じで……どう、かな？
translation: H-how does this...f-feel?

japanese: どうって言われても。
translation: I can't really say.

japanese:
（膝枕されてる、以外に
　表現しようがない状況だとしか言えないぞ）
translation:
(I can't say anything other than I'm in a situation
 where I'm using Miku's lap as a pillow.)

japanese:
ごめん……。
食べすぎのときって、どうすればいいのかわからない。
胃薬、あったかな……。
translation:
Sorry...
I don't know what to do when someone eats too much.
Maybe I have some stomach medicine...

japanese:
まあ、正直どうしようもないだろ。
消化されるまで大人しくしてる。
translation:
Ah, there's really not much to do.
Just gotta chill out until the food digests.

japanese:
そうだね……。
じゃあ、このままで……。
translation:
That's right...
Okay, we'll stay like this...

japanese: こ、このままか！？
translation: L-like this?!
...You don't like it?

japanese: い、いや、まあ……三玖がいいならいいが……。
translation: W-well, um... I'm okay if you're okay, Miku...

japanese: なら、よかった。
translation: In that case, good.

japanese:
……もう大丈夫みたいだな。
まったく、手間かけさせやがって。
translation:
...I think I may be alright.
Good grief, you really put me through a lot of trouble.

japanese: うん……おかげさまで。
translation: Yeah...because of you.

japanese:
色々ごめんね、フータロー。
それと……本当にありがとう。
translation:
Sorry for all the trouble, Futaro.
And... Really, thank you so much.

japanese:
そいつは俺じゃなくて、他のやつらに言ってくれ。
今回、一番心配してたのは、
間違いなくあいつらだからな。
translation:
Don't thank me, thank the others.
They were the ones that were most worried
this time, no doubt.

japanese: うん。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
（……うっ！
　いかん、しゃべると腹が厳しいな）
translation:
(...Ooh!
 Oh no, speaking makes my stomach hurt.)

japanese: 本当は、どれも美味かったぞ。
translation: Really, everything you cooked was delicious.

japanese:
実は、途中からそうじゃないかなって
ちょっと思ってた。
translation:
To be honest,
I thought you might be lying back there at some point.

japanese: バレてたのか……。
translation: You caught me, huh...

japanese:
だって、評価がね。
味が上品とか、余韻が感じられないとか、
フータローには言えそうにないし。
translation:
Because of the way you evaluated my food. Talking about
the refinement, or there being no umami,
that's not something you would normally say.

japanese: あと、無理してるなって……それくらいはわかる。
translation:
You were pushing yourself too hard, as well...
I could tell that much.

japanese:
（……うっ！
　いかん、しゃべると腹が厳しいな）
translation:
(...Ooh!
 Oh no, speaking makes my stomach hurt.)

japanese: サボってたから味が落ちてたぞ？
translation:
You've been slacking off,
so the taste wasn't as good as it usually is, you know?

japanese: ……本当にそう思った？
translation: ...Did you really think that?

japanese:
実を言うと、よくわからん。
けど家庭教師としては、ここでサボった分を
叱りつけるのが筋ってもんだろ？
translation:
To be honest, I'm not sure.
But as a private tutor, it isn't out of the ballpark for me
to scold you for slacking off, right?

japanese:
ふふ、そっか。
フータローは本当に仕事熱心だね。
translation:
Teehee, is that so?
You really are passionate about your work, Futaro.

japanese:
って、なんだよ。
叱られたのにずいぶんと嬉しそうにして。
translation:
What the hell?
You look pretty happy for having been scolded.

japanese: ……そんなことないよ。
translation: ...That's not true.

japanese:
すぐに取り戻すから。
次は美味しいって言わせる。
translation:
I'll rally.
And next time,
I'll make you say it's delicious next time.

japanese:
（……うっ！
　いかん、しゃべると腹が厳しいな）
translation:
(...Ooh!
 Oh no, speaking makes my stomach hurt.)

japanese: まだ、つらい？
translation: Does your stomach still hurt?

japanese:
もうしばらくダメだな。
胃が悲鳴を上げてんのが自分でもわかる。
translation:
I think it's still gonna be a while.
Even I can tell that my stomach is crying out.

japanese:
じゃあ、まだこのままだね。
なんなら、ちょっとくらい寝ちゃっても構わない。
translation:
Well then, let's just stay like this for a while.
You can even take a nap if you want.

japanese: い、いや、さすがに、この状況で寝たりはしねぇよ。
translation: N-no, I can't just sleep in a situation like this.

japanese: ……子守歌、歌ってあげようか？
translation: ...Do you want me to sing you a lullaby?

japanese: いらんわ！
translation: I don't need one!

japanese: うっ……。
translation: Urk...

japanese: フータロー？
translation: Futaro?

japanese:
すまん、しゃべるとキツい……。
しばらく黙ってるが、寝てはないからな？
translation:
Sorry, talking is tough right now...
I'll stay quiet for a while,
but I'm not sleeping, okay?

japanese:
やっぱり歌っちゃおうかな。
フータローの寝顔、独り占めできるし。
translation:
Maybe I should sing after all.
I'll be able to watch you sleep.
I'll treasure this memory we shared.

japanese:
……勘弁してくれ。
寝顔を見られるのは苦手なんだよ。
translation:
...Please spare me.
I don't like it when people watch me sleep.
